name: Bulbasaur
lore: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

name: Ivysaur
lore: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

name: Venusaur
lore: Venusaur's flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.

name: Charmander
lore: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself.

name: Charmeleon
lore: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive.

name: Charizard
lore: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything.

name: Squirtle
lore: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

name: Wartortle
lore: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

name: Blastoise
lore: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

name: Caterpie
lore: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

name: Metapod
lore: Its shell is as hard as an iron slab. A Metapod does not move very much because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the shell.

name: Butterfree
lore: Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.

name: Weedle
lore: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It distinguishes its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes by sniffing with its big red nose.

name: Kakuna
lore: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution.

name: Beedrill
lore: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

name: Pidgey
lore: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

name: Pidgeotto
lore: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

name: Pidgeot
lore: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: Rattata
lore: Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around.

name: Raticate
lore: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

name: Spearow
lore: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.

name: Fearow
lore: Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water.

name: Ekans
lore: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a headbutt or bite.

name: Arbok
lore: Arbok is capable of crushing opponents by coiling its body around them and squeezing. Its mighty body can snap a steel drum like a toy.

name: Pikachu
lore: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.

name: Raichu
lore: If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokémon's nest.

name: Sandshrew
lore: Sandshrew's body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up to protect itself from its enemies.

name: Sandslash
lore: Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered with large spikes. Its hide is extremely hard.

name: Nidoran♀
lore: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon.

name: Nidorina
lore: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other.

name: Nidoqueen
lore: Nidoqueen's body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles.

name: Nidoran♂
lore: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction.

name: Nidorino
lore: Nidorino's horn contains venom. If they are angered, the potency of their venom increases.

name: Nidoking
lore: Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower.

name: Clefairy
lore: Clefairy are said to be rarely seen by people and are thought to be drawn by the full moon to dance at night.

name: Clefable
lore: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water.

name: Vulpix
lore: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

name: Ninetales
lore: Ninetales is said to live for a thousand years. Each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

name: Jigglypuff
lore: Jigglypuff's vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.

name: Wigglytuff
lore: Wigglytuff has a body that is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

name: Zubat
lore: Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.

name: Golbat
lore: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night.

name: Oddish
lore: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

name: Gloom
lore: Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens.

name: Vileplume
lore: Vileplume's toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. It is said to scatter its pollen with every step it takes.

name: Paras
lore: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host.

name: Parasect
lore: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another.

name: Venonat
lore: Venonat is said to be attracted by light at night. It is often seen near bright lights.

name: Venomoth
lore: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its wings are covered in scales that scatter a highly toxic dust.

name: Diglett
lore: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple—wherever they burrow, the soil is left perfectly tilled for growing delicious crops.

name: Dugtrio
lore: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two.

name: Meowth
lore: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to silently sneak about. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.

name: Persian
lore: Persian has a violent temperament. It will scratch anyone, even its Trainer, with its sharp claws if displeased.

name: Psyduck
lore: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the headache intensifies, it starts using mysterious powers.

name: Golduck
lore: Golduck is often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa, due to its webbed hands and feet.

name: Mankey
lore: Mankey can become furious if even simply stared at. Once angry, it will chase anyone relentlessly.

name: Primeape
lore: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger.

name: Growlithe
lore: Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokémon won't forget the scent, no matter what.

name: Arcanine
lore: Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night.

name: Poliwag
lore: Poliwag's thin and damp skin is easily seen through. The spiral on its belly is actually its internal organs showing through.

name: Poliwhirl
lore: The surface of Poliwhirl's body is always wet and slick with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.

name: Poliwrath
lore: Poliwrath's highly developed muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. This Pokémon can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.

name: Abra
lore: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping, and will teleport itself to safety.

name: Kadabra
lore: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a strong psyche can hope to become a Trainer of this Pokémon.

name: Alakazam
lore: Alakazam's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up using its psychic powers instead.

name: Machop
lore: Machop's muscles are special—they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.

name: Machoke
lore: Machoke's thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. It is known as the Pokémon that can lift a dump truck with one hand.

name: Machamp
lore: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, because it is so strong, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

name: Bellsprout
lore: Bellsprout's thin, flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be.

name: Weepinbell
lore: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear. At night, it hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves while sleeping, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.

name: Victreebel
lore: Victreebel's mouth is wide enough to swallow a whole adult. It attracts prey with a sweet aroma.

name: Tentacool
lore: Tentacool's body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.

name: Tentacruel
lore: Tentacruel has eighty tentacles that can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.

name: Geodude
lore: Geodude climbs mountain paths using only the power of its arms. Because they look just like boulders, careless hikers may step on them.

name: Graveler
lore: Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss.

name: Golem
lore: Golem is known for rolling down mountain paths at high speed. It is so hard, even dynamite can't scratch its body.

name: Ponyta
lore: Ponyta is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.

name: Rapidash
lore: Rapidash usually can be seen casually galloping in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery mane flares and races as fast as 150 mph.

name: Slowpoke
lore: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.

name: Slowbro
lore: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.

name: Magnemite
lore: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers—there may be a Magnemite loose.

name: Magneton
lore: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.

name: Farfetch'd
lore: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight over stalks.

name: Doduo
lore: Doduo's two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping so one can always keep watch for enemies.

name: Dodrio
lore: Dodrio's three heads represent joy, sadness, and anger. It runs at nearly 40 mph when at full speed.

name: Seel
lore: Seel's entire body is covered in a pure white, smooth, and velvety coat. This Pokémon loves frigid, ice-covered seas.

name: Dewgong
lore: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

name: Grimer
lore: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.

name: Muk
lore: Muk's body contains toxic elements, and it will readily leak a foul-smelling, poisonous fluid from all over its body.

name: Shellder
lore: Shellder's hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: Cloyster
lore: Cloyster's shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

name: Gastly
lore: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away.

name: Haunter
lore: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.

name: Gengar
lore: Gengar is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

name: Onix
lore: Onix tunnels underground at over 50 miles per hour. As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

name: Drowzee
lore: Drowzee puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally, it gets sick from eating only bad dreams.

name: Hypno
lore: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis while this Pokémon gleefully eats their dreams.

name: Krabby
lore: Krabby's pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

name: Kingler
lore: Kingler's large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

name: Voltorb
lore: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokémon looks very similar to a Poké Ball remains a mystery.

name: Electrode
lore: Electrode eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when lightning strikes, you can see this Pokémon exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.

name: Exeggcute
lore: Exeggcute consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.

name: Exeggutor
lore: Exeggutor is known as 'The Walking Jungle.' Each of the nuts has a face and will grow into an Exeggcute if it falls off.

name: Cubone
lore: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull it wears are from its tears.

name: Marowak
lore: Marowak overcame its sadness at the loss of its mother and grew tough. Its tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.

name: Hitmonlee
lore: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs to relax the muscles.

name: Hitmonchan
lore: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. Its punches slice through the air at incredible speeds.

name: Lickitung
lore: Lickitung's tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.

name: Koffing
lore: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas.

name: Weezing
lore: Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. It can often be found in garbage dumps searching for food.

name: Rhyhorn
lore: Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel.

name: Rhydon
lore: Rhydon's horn can bore through solid rock. Its tail can topple a building with a single whack.

name: Chansey
lore: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.

name: Tangela
lore: Tangela's body is covered by blue vines. No one has ever seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.

name: Kangaskhan
lore: Kangaskhan's baby is protected by its mother's pouch. The mother will risk its life to protect its young.

name: Horsea
lore: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If it senses danger, it sprays ink into the water to escape.

name: Seadra
lore: Seadra's body bristles with sharp spines. The spines secrete poison, and its fins and tail are highly developed for swimming.

name: Goldeen
lore: Goldeen's tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

name: Seaking
lore: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male will make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using its horn.

name: Staryu
lore: Staryu's center section, called the core, glows brightly in the night sky. It is said to communicate with the stars.

name: Starmie
lore: Starmie emits radio signals into the night sky. The core of this Pokémon shines in seven colors, a rainbow.

name: Mr. Mime
lore: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists.

name: Scyther
lore: Scyther's sharp scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.

name: Jynx
lore: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so captivating that people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without noticing.

name: Electabuzz
lore: Electabuzz wind up all sorts of electrical machinery and cause blackouts. They appear in power plants in search of electricity.

name: Magmar
lore: Magmar's body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

name: Pinsir
lore: Pinsir grips its prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far away.

name: Tauros
lore: Tauros charges while whipping its hefty body with its tails. Once it starts charging, it stops for nothing.

name: Magikarp
lore: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.

name: Gyarados
lore: Gyarados is an extremely vicious and violent Pokémon. When humans begin to fight, it will appear and burn everything to the ground with intensely hot flames.

name: Lapras
lore: Lapras is a gentle soul that can ferry people across the sea on its back. It loves to sing and its beautiful voice can be heard from afar.

name: Ditto
lore: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on memory, this Pokémon manages to get details wrong.

name: Eevee
lore: Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokémon to evolve.

name: Vaporeon
lore: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has the ability to control water.

name: Jolteon
lore: Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts.

name: Flareon
lore: Flareon's fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot.

name: Porygon
lore: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy-protected, so it cannot be duplicated.

name: Omanyte
lore: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws into its hard shell.

name: Omastar
lore: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, making its movements slow.

name: Kabuto
lore: Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in rare cases, living examples have been discovered. This Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.

name: Kabutops
lore: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land.

name: Aerodactyl
lore: Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from DNA extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.

name: Snorlax
lore: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its big belly as a place to play.

name: Articuno
lore: Articuno is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains. This Pokémon's beautiful wings are made of ice.

name: Zapdos
lore: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

name: Moltres
lore: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control fire. If injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

name: Dratini
lore: Dratini is called the 'Mirage Pokémon' because so few have seen it. It is said to shed its skin as it grows, often hiding deep in rivers.

name: Dragonair
lore: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter the weather around it by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.

name: Dragonite
lore: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just sixteen hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

name: Mewtwo
lore: Mewtwo was created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon, and it is highly intelligent and powerful.

name: Mew
lore: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
